application_instruction: Note: By applying to this position your application is automatically submitted to the following locations: San Francisco, CA, USA; Mountain View, CA, USA; New York, NY, USA
description:
People Ops is always looking to make the experience of work better and more meaningful for Googlers. But innovating (and operating!) is increasingly complex when Googlers work in more than 50 countries, each with its own unique practices and regulations. The Diversity, Integrity & Governance team works to make sure we not only do what’s required by law, but that we continue to raise the bar and do what’s right for Googlers all over the globe. From supporting LGBT rights to extending parental leave benefits, we aspire to do the right thing in every part of the world: to be fair and inclusive, disciplined but not rigid, and consistent but not bureaucratic.

The Community Inclusion pod will direct and focus the energy of Googler-led communities, their executive sponsors, and external community partners to drive diverse representation and a culture of Inclusion We are highly-collaborative and have an emphasis on the ability to form evaluate and communicate programs across internal and external affinity groups and allies.

As part of People Operations, the Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) team focuses on increasing equity in partnership with internal leaders, communities, and our Employee Resource Group (ERGs) network. Our mission is to put the community and our employees first by accelerating our hiring, progression, and retention goals for underrepresented groups.

Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (you probably know us better as "Human Resources"). Made up of equal parts HR professionals, former consultants and analysts, we're the champions of Google's colorful culture. In People Ops, we "find them, grow them, and keep them" - we bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next great Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • Experience on diversity and inclusion, racial equity, and programs designed to advance marginalized or underrepresented communities.
  • 5 years of experience in human resources or a related function.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Ability to comfortably lead through ambiguity, taking thoughtful risks and executing with a bias to action.
  • Ability to represent the strategy and work across all levels to mobilize communities and influence leaders to take action.
  • Understanding of the meaning of Googlers, users, customers, and partners to our business. Ability to focus on the user.
  • Ability to integrate and communicate ideas, insights, and strategy. Excellent project management/development, implementation, and evaluation skills.
  • Ability to work with diverse teams, partners, and customers. Excellent relationships-building and influencing skills.
  • Excellent problem-solving, relationships-building, influencing, and analytical skills. Demonstrated curiosity and strategic mindset.
responsibilities:
• Develop an internal evaluation strategy and framework for use and scale globally under the direction of the Global Head of Community Inclusion.
  • Designing an evaluation model to measure, benchmark and grow Community Inclusion outcomes and key results. Create a partnership model and framework to bolster key outcomes in partnership with business leaders and ERG leads and members.
  • Communicate strategy and position to DEI and ERGs leaders. Implement the evaluation strategy and framework for DEI and analyze results to create a long-term plan to increase partnership between DEI and ERG leads.
  • Design an evaluation strategy and framework for ERG leads across multiple regions. Managing daily ERG operations for Community Inclusion and create systems to handle ERG-related requests.
  • Manage team members.
title: Community Evaluation and Communications Manager
